channel.title: Port help
channel.description: ok well ive done the no-ip thing and ive done portforwarding correctly (i think). i can log onto my server with 127.0.0.1 (my local) but when i try to log onto it with the no-ip that i made, it says error connecting to server. so i go to canyouseeme.org, and it says it cant see through my ports or whatever, reason: connection refused. sometimes its different and it says the connection has timed out. i have allowed the port through my firewall, so thats not the problem. anyone have any ideas at all? All help appreciated.

item.title: Port help
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Please follow supra s’ post.

item.title: Port help
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked.
Requesting a host, ‘coder’/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related.
That means for other sections on this site too.

Rules: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,331370.0.html
More info about portforwarding - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,442058.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Port help
item.dc:creator: @Sidewindscape Sidewindscape
item.description:
@Sidewindscape wrote:

ok well ive done the no-ip thing and ive done portforwarding correctly (i think). i can log onto my server with 127.0.0.1 (my local) but when i try to log onto it with the no-ip that i made, it says error connecting to server. so i go to canyouseeme.org, and it says it cant see through my ports or whatever, reason: connection refused. sometimes its different and it says the connection has timed out. i have allowed the port through my firewall, so thats not the problem. anyone have any ideas at all?
All help appreciated.

Read full topic
